page.title: 17HAILSHAM STRING FACTORY
page.content: The{String Factory}was founded in {1824}by George Hawkin. He used to make saddles and guns. They used to make string for farming purposes and {Hangmen's Ropes!}It was also used for rigging and naval boats. The factory covers 8 acres of land now.It used to have 16 acres because they needed space for the string walks. Today they have{250}workers and about{300}machines. The smaller machines are used for making string and small ropes. There are many splicing machines. They use nylon, twine and polypropolene for modern string. People all over the world including {BRITISH TELECOM,THE POST OFFICE, {SHIPPING AND OIL RIGS}use string products made in Hailsham.
